text: Richard Jay Belzer (August 4, 1944 â€“ February 19 2023) was an American stand- up comedian and actor. He was also a conspiracy author. He is best known for his role as John Munch, on the NBC police drama series Homicide: Life on the Street and Law & Order: Special Victims Unit. Belzer believed there was a conspiracy to assassinate President John F. Kennedy. He wrote four books discussing conspiracy theories. Belzer was a cousin of actor Henry Winkler. Belzer died at his home in Beaulieu-sur-Mer, France on February 19, 2023, at age 78. The cause of death was cardiopulmonary arrest caused by heart and respiratory failure. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * NBC Biography * NNDB Profile Category:1944 births Category:2023 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:Jewish American comedians Category:Jewish American actors Category:American television personalities Category:American radio personalities Category:American television presenters Category:Comedians from Connecticut Category:Democrats (United States) Category:Actors from Bridgeport, Connecticut Category:Writers from Connecticut Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Deaths from cardiopulmonary arrest
title: Richard Belzer
